meanings.definition: To surpass in cheating or deceit.
meanings.sent1: She outcheated her opponent by using a hidden cheat sheet during the exam.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to outcheat his friends in games, but they catch on quickly.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon outcheated the clever fox in stealing the picnic basket.
meanings.sent4: Her lies outcheated the truth, creating a web of deception.
meanings.sent5: The magician outcheated the audience with his clever tricks.

meanings.definition: To cheat more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: The student outcheated his classmates by copying all the answers from the internet.
meanings.sent2: She felt guilty when she realized she had outcheated her best friend in the competition.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat outcheated the dog by sneaking extra treats from the pantry.
meanings.sent4: His elaborate scheme to outcheat his rival backfired, leading to his own downfall.
meanings.sent5: The cunning fox outcheated the hunter by leading him on a wild goose chase.
